work.name: Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
work.summary: I worked as teaching assistant for several courses at IIT Delhi while pursuing my masters. The courses were Data Structures, Data Mining and AI for Earth Observation. The work included preparing questionnaire, assigments, grading and guiding the students taking these courses. This helped me understand the courses from the point of view of a mentor.

work.name: Informatica Business Solutions
work.summary: I worked as UI software developer for the Enterprise Data Catalog (EDC) UI team (R&D department) at Informatica Business Solutions, Bengaluru. My work was aimed at security enhancements of the website apart from addressing regular customer requirements. One of the projects that I was part of was Catalog Proxy Layer Removal which reduced loading time by a factor of 70% without any regression issues. I was also one of the few members of our team who got to work on both Catalog and Admin modules.

volunteer.summary: Conducted seminar for the elderly at the old age home regarding current technologies available useful for them. Also, held seminar for health and nutrition for elderly to help them understand the importance of dietary regiments in day to day life.

Participated in sessions for teaching children in village (namely, Miroli near Ahmedabad) to acquaint them with basic knowledge of Maths, Languages and Moral Sciences. Also, helped in spreading awareness among the adults in village regarding the importance of knowledge.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
